definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: When you are old and grey and full of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 當你老了，白髮蒼蒼，睡意朦朧。

sentences.english: Years later, I totter by the River in white hair.
sentences.chinese: 許多年之後，我白髮蒼蒼的蹣跚走在河邊。

sentences.english: He was a grey-haired old man.
sentences.chinese: 他已是一位白髮蒼蒼的老頭。

sentences.english: He is a grey-haired thin old man.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位白髮蒼蒼的瘦老頭。

sentences.english: “You have big hands, ” the white-haired doctor said as he shook the patient’s hand.
sentences.chinese: “你的手較大，”白髮蒼蒼的醫生和病人握手時說道。

sentences.english: Gray hairs in their respective go see a water out and who embrace leave.
sentences.chinese: 白髮蒼蒼各自去看場細水長流與着誰擁抱離去。

sentences.english: Spend the two people from the white-haired, how long.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人從相守到白髮蒼蒼，需要多久。

sentences.english: I do not want to remarry him.
sentences.chinese: 我可不希望到了白髮蒼蒼和他復婚。

sentences.english: White-haired folks reading the paper on their farmhouse porches at sunset.
sentences.chinese: 夕陽西下時，白髮蒼蒼的老人們坐在家舍門廊上看報。

sentences.english: Just then a white-haired woman entered supported by the team leader.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時，一位白髮蒼蒼的婦女由隊長扶着走了進來。

sentences.english: Do not always say that their old, out of mind the old, white-haired then why not?
sentences.chinese: 不要總說自己老了，心不老，白髮蒼蒼又何妨？

definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
